programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A lawyer dies in a road accident while on honeymoon and his unharmed wife's behavior intrigues his family.

programme.desc: A rich widow is found hanged on her barge leaving an inheritance of 14 million euros. Was it suicide?

programme.desc: Firefighters respond to a fire and find the lifeless body of the owner lying in a large pool of blood.

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight
programme.desc: An evening's celebration is cut short when a couple is shot on a beach in Jacksonville, Florida.

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight
programme.desc: In the 1970s, Janet Walsh is tied-up and strangled on her bed after a night of disco dancing.

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight
programme.desc: Police are puzzled when they find the body of a divorced mother curled up by the side of a road.

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight
programme.desc: Sue Snow takes some pills in the morning and dies suddenly from cyanide poisoning.

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight
programme.desc: Rozanne Gailiunas opens her door for a floral delivery and ends up shot in the head.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives hosted by Nancy Grace
programme.desc: In 1987, Terry Wood comes home to find his wife Roxanne dead on the kitchen floor. Detectives struggle to find the culprit. Only the revolutionary method of forensic genetic genealogy can provide answers 35 years later.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives hosted by Nancy Grace
programme.desc: In 2001, a 7-year-old girl is kidnapped and raped by an unknown assailant in Colorado. The victim lives in fear as the perpetrator is nowhere to be found — until nearly 20 years later, thanks to an exciting new forensic tool.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives hosted by Nancy Grace
programme.desc: Texas, 1974. Carla Walker is celebrating Valentine's Day when she is kidnapped, raped and murdered. All investigative leads run dry, but nearly 46 years later science brings the agonizing search to an end.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Colin Ireland made a New Year’s resolution in 1993 to become a serial killer and then murdered five gay men in London. In 2006, he got a whole life term.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: In 1977, Angus Sinclair kidnapped, raped and murdered two seventeen-year-old girls after meeting them in a pub in Glasgow, Scotland.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Aileen Wuornos, one of America’s most prolific serial killers, murdered seven men in Florida by shooting them at point-blank range. She was eventually convicted and sentenced to death.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Robert Lee Yates Junior was a well-respected family man and war hero, but by night he was a cold-blooded serial killer. He was convicted of killing fourteen young women and one man.
